Dispute_Type: Liability and limitation of liability in maritime collision
Legal_Issue: Whether Sheena M Interests can obtain a stay of the liability action while pursuing a limitation action
Governing_Law: 1976 Convention on Limitation of Liability for Maritime Claims
Section 50(1)(b) of the Federal Court Act
Burden_of_Proof: On Sheena M Interests to demonstrate that a stay is in the interests of justice
Legal_Rule: Shipowners may limit liability unless intentional or reckless fault is proven; courts may grant a stay under Section 50(1)(b) of the Federal Court Act if it serves the interests of justice
Procedural_Issue: Risk of prejudice from concurrent proceedings
Grounds_for_Claim: Collision between tugboat Sheena M and CPR bridge resulting in damages
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided; liability action stayed pending outcome of limitation action
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Continuing liability action would prejudice Sheena M Interests without significant benefit to CPR
Key_Evidence_Considered: Potential disruption to business and increased legal costs for Sheena M Interests
Applicant_Challenge: Sheena M Interests seeking to avoid duplicative litigation and financial burden
Court_Result: Stay granted in favor of Sheena M Interests, except as against Rivtow Marine Ltd.
Legal_Rule_Source: 1976 Convention on Limitation of Liability for Maritime Claims
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities / interests of justice
Evidence_Type: Affidavit evidence on business impact and legal costs
Outcome: Stay granted; liability action paused until resolution of limitation action
Claimant_Status: Sheena M Interests as shipowner/defendant in liability action and applicant in limitation action
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 50(1)(b) of the Federal Court Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: No allegation of intentional or reckless fault established
Applicable_Process: Limitation of liability proceeding under international convention
Governing_Rule: 1976 Convention on Limitation of Liability for Maritime Claims
